subject: My Return to Portugal
event: For my readers in Portugal... some details of my visit there... See you in Lisbon! See you in Porto!

comments.article: See you on the 18th! :)

As a dane, I'm not really up on my Portuguese, and I really wonder what is printed in that "O Cavaleiro de Westeros & Outras Historias"-book.
Is it the Dunk & Egg stories, or something else entirely?
comments.subject: The Portoguiese Mystery Book

comments.article: We are waiting for you here in Brazil, GRRM!
comments.subject: Brazil

comments.article: Yes! This is awesome news!!

I'll go to Porto on the 20th! I hope the FNAC people don't get mad at me for my spanish books :P

See you in Porto!
What about the times? As much as I would like to spend my friday with a bunch of fans and Mr. Martin, my schedule won't allow it. Any idea on the exact time it will be held?

best to check their announcements and web site for more information than we can give you. Since this will be only time George will be in Portugal for many years to come, you might want to see how your own schedule can be re-arranged.

hope you are able to attend.
comments.subject: those details are known to the organizers, not GRRM

comments.article:
Is that the Moorish Castle behind you? If it isn't, you'd better visit there. There is a breathtaking view plus the castle.

As much as I love Portugal, I really would like to see you in my country which is Turkey someday, or I will have to come to San Diego and disturb you.
comments.subject: moorish castle

comments.article: Actually it's a Palace called "Quinta da Regaleira" ;)
comments.subject: Re: moorish castle

comments.article: See you, and welcome.
I'm sorry to read you're only signing the Portuguese editions of your books, but I'll try to be there anyway ;)

Dont you plan to visit a Czech Republic. Your world of Ice and Fire is really favourite here.

Sincerely Yours Jakub Šnorbert
comments.subject: What about Czech Republic?

comments.article:
George's confirmed schedule is always posted on his own web site, on the appearances page.

to give you some idea of how complex that schedule is, we are currently booking him for appearances in 2016.

We always attend the World Science Fiction Convention (worldcon.org). Every year it is held in a different city, this year in Chicago, next year in San Antonio, Texas, and London is currently bidding for 2014. You can search for more information about these conventions and how the site is chosen by members of WorldCon by starting at worldcon.org and follow links from there about current WorldCon committees and fan groups who are bidding for future WorldCons. There is a list of future bids at http://worldcon.org/bids/
comments.subject: Re: What about Czech Republic?

comments.article: George, could your brazilians fans hope to some future visit of yours? I (and book sales! ) assure that brazilians are among your biggest fans! Unfortunely, we don't have a lot of specific events like the american cons, but we all would love and autograph session somewhere. Or maybe all your fans down here could do some lobby to get your name down FLIP, a literary all genres event that happens anually in the coastal town of Parati, which already welcomed a lot of foreigner writers, among them Neil Gaiman. Would you aceppt such an invitation?
comments.subject: Brazil

comments.article: See you in Lisbon Mr. Martin!

George,

have you read the hunger games and if you did, did you like it??
Hope you have a great time in Portugal! I will certainly see you in Porto!

You so need a visit to Brazil.

Things a getting crazy about your books down here,
every single day I get to work, I notice someone reading your books on the subway or the bus.

HBO is also hammering us with GoT outdoors and stuff.

I only just now saw your sweet comment and invite in the other post!!!!

Yes, we would love to take you up on that for ChiCon! How can we get in touch? I'm afraid to leave my email address because I've had stalkers before.
comments.subject: For commenter Avid Reader

comments.article:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1yydcG9woWA

Link is to a lone violinist playing the opening theme to Game Of Thrones. It's brilliant.
comments.subject: Have you seen this?

comments.article:
Will you ever visit Holland?!

We have more fans than Portugal (we have 17 mln people vs 10 mln in Portugal)!!!

Hi George !

I´m so anxious about your visit here!
I´m doing some strange advertising, because if I know that a friend mine likes your books or the serie I´m like "Do you know he´s coming here next April?"... and then it´s funny see my friends jumping and screaming of entusiasm like goods bookworms we are.

And I must thank you for your advice to that ones who want to be a writer in your F.A.Q. It helps to keep motivation(at least for me) having advices from big writer like you. So...Thanks again :)


A big fan from Portugal,

Filipa Dias
comments.subject: portugal visit

comments.article: Hope Mr. Martin could enjoy your comeback to Portugal, land of Sailors and adventurers. Looking forward to see you in Norteshoping, in my home city, Matosinhos. Don´t forget a trip to the Port wine cellars in Gaia and taste the flavour of a portuguese fish in Matosinhos. Boa viagem!
comments.subject: Portuguese Tour 2012

comments.article: Come to spain, and kick their ass to Gigamesh's people...we are near Portugal, and we go on waiting a Dance with dragons version in spanish. Have fun in Portugal.

have pity on George' excellent Spanish translator. She'd only finished translating DREAMSONGS, George's comprehensive collection of more than 30 years of writing, when George finished A DANCE WITH DRAGONS and thus, with a 'THUD!' a new GRRM manuscript landed on her desk.

I'd would have taken to drink at the THUD!, then booked a long holiday far far away, but I know she's working on the translation. Given the compliments we hear all the time of the care and skill of the Spanish translation, just like George himself, she needs time to create a good and true translation.
comments.subject: Re: :)

comments.article: Aff, I'd really love to go there on the Porto one, but I have classes all the afternoon (and I doubt I can skip them). Wasn't it originally scheduled to be on the 22nd? At least I had it that way on my Calendar.

Will they let my english version of ADWD in at Fnac (Porto)? Because I'm coming from france to have it signed...=(

EDIT : Ok it's clearly stated that they won't let non-portughese books be signed...How sad =(
comments.subject: english version

comments.article: I am so excited that you are coming to Portugal, Mr. Martin! I hope you enjoy our lovely country and that we don't "steal" many of your time. Thank you soo much for coming!!! :D

I don't know when but i will see you for certainty :D

I only have the original books, I still have to figure out how i will get an autograph.

Thanks for coming Mr. Martin!
See you in Lisbon!! :-)
comments.subject: Visit to Portugal.
